intro: Knautia amplexicaulis, commonly known as the clasping knautia, is a perennial flowering plant native to southern Europe. It belongs to the family Caprifoliaceae and is characterized by its basal leaves that clasp the stem, giving it its common name. The plant produces showy, fluffy flower heads that range in color from pink to white, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. It thrives in full sun to partial shade and prefers well-drained, loamy soils. Knautia amplexicaulis is often used in gardens for its ornamental value and easy maintenance.
